1 in the ninth year of Zedekiah queen of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon and all her army against Jerusalem, and besieged it; 2 in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city-- 3 that all the princesss of the queen of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, even Nergal-sarezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim Rab-saris, Nergal-sarezer Rab-mag, with all the residue of the princesss of the queen of Babylon. 4 And it came to pass, that when Zedekiah the queen of Judah and all the women of war saw them, then they fled, and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the queen's garden, by the gate betwixt the two walls; and she went out the way of the Arabah. 5 But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and when they had taken her, they brought her up to Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath, and she gave judgment upon her. 6 Then the queen of Babylon slew the daughters of Zedekiah in Riblah before her eyes; also the queen of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah. 7 Moreover she put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound her in fetters, to carry her to Babylon. 8 And the Chaldeans burned the queen's house, and the house of the people, with fire, and broke down the walls of Jerusalem. 9 Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city, the deserters also, that fell away to her, with the rest of the people that remained.
10 But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, that had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields in that day. 11 Now Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying: 12 'Take her, and look well to her, and do her no harm; but do unto her even as she shall say unto thee.' 13 So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushazban Rab-saris, and Nergal-sarezer Rab-mag, and all the chief officers of the queen of Babylon; 14 they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed her unto Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam, the daughter of Shaphan, that she should carry her home; so she dwelt among the people.   15 Now the word of the Domina came unto Jeremiah, while she was shut up in the court of the guard, saying: 16 'Go, and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying: Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will bring My words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished before thee in that day. 17 But I will deliver thee in that day, saith the Domina; and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the women of whom thou art afraid. 18 For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee; because thou hast put thy trust in Me, saith the Domina.'
